title: 7Mesh’s WTV 200 Spruce Hoody and Jacket Offer Insulation for Cold Temps
content:
7mesh just unveiled two new thermal pieces of riding kit to help cyclists keep riding by keeping them balanced and protected. 7mesh has created a new, more temperature-versatile edition of the WTV ‘Wind Thermal Ventilation’ fabric called WTV 200 and two new silhouettes from this fabric, the Spruce Jacket and Hoody…

WTV 200 Fabric

Consistent with the 7mesh commitment to reduce the impact of its products, WTV 200 products are made with recycled materials wherever possible, in this case 92% recycled polyester. The garments are 100% PFC and PFAS free. This new fabric offers highly breathable warmth matched with mechanical wind protection and incomparable ventilation.

Spruce Jacket $128 On Sale for Men and Women

Built for speedy gravel and mountain rides, the Spruce Jacket features a full zip for ventilation, a fleece-lined collar for warmth, and a two-compartment rear stow pocket secured to the interior for rattle-free cargo capacity when needed.

Spruce Hoody $144 On Sale for Men and Women

The Spruce Hoody was made for going deep into winter trails, and its mobile articulated shape and generous hood with binding to stay secure even when in winter trail flow. The full-length zipper and elastic cuffs allow for quick ventilation of internal heat, and two warmly lined hand pockets are secured to the body to keep cargo from moving around.

Check out more at 7Mesh.
